lessons.japanese: その橋は洪水で流された。
lessons.english: The bridge was carried away by the flood.

lessons.japanese: その橋は洪水で押し流されてしまった。
lessons.english: The bridge was carried away by the flood.

lessons.japanese: その橋は洪水で流された。
lessons.english: The bridge was washed away by the flood.

lessons.japanese: 私たちは洪水の被災者に食べ物と衣類を提供した。
lessons.english: We provided the flood victims with food and clothing.

lessons.japanese: 家が数軒その大洪水で流された。
lessons.english: Several houses were carried away by the great flood.

lessons.japanese: 家は洪水で押し流された。
lessons.english: The house was carried away by the flood.

lessons.japanese: 何軒かの別荘が洪水で孤立した。
lessons.english: Several cottages have been isolated by the flood water.

lessons.japanese: ラジオで洪水の警告をしていた。
lessons.english: The radio warned us of the possibility of flooding.

lessons.japanese: もう少し雨がひどくなると、洪水の恐れがある。
lessons.english: A little heavier rain might cause a flood.

lessons.japanese: たくさんの家が洪水で流された。
lessons.english: A lot of houses were washed away by the flood.

lessons.japanese: 激しい雨がその流域に洪水をもたらした。
lessons.english: The heavy rain brought floods in the valley.

lessons.japanese: その台風でたいへんな洪水になった。
lessons.english: The typhoon resulted in a lot of flooding.

lessons.japanese: その村は洪水で孤立した。
lessons.english: The village was isolated by the flood.

lessons.japanese: その洪水は彼らが体験したうちで最大の災害だった。
lessons.english: The flood was the greatest disaster they had ever had.

lessons.japanese: その洪水は彼らが経験した中で最悪の災害だった。
lessons.english: The flood was the greatest disaster they had ever had.
